description.en: A room assigned to one person
A room assigned to two person
A room with two beds
A room with a king-sized bed
A room with a queen-sized bed
A room assigned to three people
A room assigned to four people
A room with two double (or perhaps queen) beds
A room with a studio bed â€“ a couch that can be converted into a bed. May also have an additional bed
A parlour or living room connected to one or more bedrooms
A single room with a bed and sitting area. Sometimes the sleeping area is in a bedroom separate from the parlour or living room
Rooms with individual entrance doors from the outside and a connecting door between. Guests can move between rooms without going through the hallway
Rooms close to each other, perhaps across the hall
Rooms with a common wall, but no connecting door

The most expensive room provided by a hotel. Usually, only one president suite is available in one single hotel property. Similar to the normal suites, a president suite always has one or more bedrooms and a living space with a strong emphasis on grand in-room decoration, high-quality amenities and supplies, and tailor-made services (e.g. personal butler during the stay)

The most expensive room provided by a hotel. Usually, only one president suite is available in one single hotel property. Similar to the normal suites, a president suite always has one or more bedrooms and a living space with a strong emphasis on grand in-room decoration, high-quality amenities and supplies, and tailor-made services (e.g. personal butler during the stay)
Open kitchens, cooking equipment, dryer, washer etc. are usually available in the room. Usually housekeeping services are only provided once in a week or two times in a week
A room that is fitted with a sofa bed or a Murphy bed (i.e. a bed that folds out of a wall or closet) which can be transformed from a bedroom in the night time to a living room in daytime
This room type is mainly designed for disabled guests and it is required by law that hotels must provide a certain number of accessible rooms to avoid discrimination
This room type is mainly designed for disabled guests and it is required by law that hotels must provide a certain number of accessible rooms to avoid discrimination
This type of room is always adjoining to the swimming pool or have a private pool attached to the room

It is a kind of stand-alone house which gives extra privacy and space to hotel guests. A fully equipped villa contains not only bedrooms and a living room but a private swimming pool, Jacuzzi and balcony. It is suitable for couples, families and large groups
It is a very comfortable twin room containing a double bed with two single beds joined by a similar headboard
This room type includes several rooms, usually a living room and a bed room. It may also have a separate functional kitchen
For Luxury lovers, a super deluxe hotel room might just be the ideal room option for you. It is an upgrade of the standard deluxe room

A penthouse is a unit or an apartment on the highest floor of the hotel, condominium or apartment building. They are different for the unique amenities they offer (ex. swimming pool, private elevator, terrace, jacuzzi...))
This type is composed of two rooms located on two different floors, connected with internal stairs
This room faces a landscape, a waterfall, or a garden
